sentences.sContent: By the time she was eight, she could read Greek and Latin.
sentences.sCn: 她八岁时就会读希腊文和拉丁文了。

sentences.sContent: In those days you could buy a box of cigars for a dollar.
sentences.sCn: 那时候，一美元能买一盒雪茄烟。

sentences.sContent: Could you hear what I was saying?
I couldn’t get tickets after all, they were sold out.
sentences.sCn: 我最终还是没能弄到票，全都卖完了。

sentences.sContent: I knew I couldn’t afford the rent.
The teacher said we could all go home.
sentences.sCn: 老师说我们都可以回家了。

phrases.pCn: 本来能做成的（却没做成）
没人能做到；那么别人也休想

trans.tranCn: 能，会，可以〔can 的过去式〕
trans.tranOther: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
